results.title: Two faces of Gove
results.creator_credit: John Sparkes, Ron Iddon and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Looks at the situation at Gove, after the 1971 Land Rights Case, in which Naalco were given clear title to the lease. Considers the effect of the decision on the people of Yirrakala. Construction workers talk about their attitudes and relations with the Aborigines. Shows social life and bauxite mining procedures.

results.title: Two eight bravo
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Grahame Jennings Productions and James M. Olsson
results.brief_description: An army recruitment film which captures the drama of battle. A tank hits a land-mine in Vietnam, and we follow the journey of the crippled tank back to Australia where repairs begin. Young Army apprentices, in training, learn how to repair tanks, aircraft and modern equipment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Grahame Jennings Productions and James M. Olsson

results.title: Two Different Worlds (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A story of children challenging the attitudes of their migrant parents and growing apart from their discipline and culture. The repercussions of holding two standards - that of their parents and that of the new Australian society. How do they cope with two values.

results.title: Two deserts: Sahara and Sonora
results.creator_credit: Audio Visual Productions and Andrew B. Nemes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Shows what characteristics the Sahara Desert in Africa and the Sonora Desert in North America have in common, and explains how factors of economics, religion, culture and technology make the regions different.

results.title: Two decades
results.creator_credit: N.V.K. Murty and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The history of India since the end of British Colonial rule, and the beginning of the end of colonial rule all over the world. Highlights are the passing of great men; the achievement of internal unity in spite of religious and class differences. Five year plans have changed the face of India but much remains to be achieved.

results.title: Two cities: London and New York
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari, John H Secondari Productions, Learning Corporation of America and Helen Jean Secondari
results.brief_description: A comparison of the quality of life and approach to urban problems of two western English speaking capital cities. Varied in their ethnic make up, cultural traditions, physical layout and community organisation, London and New York offer very different advantages and problems.

results.title: Two Chinese dancers
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and Chinese Film Enterprises of America
results.brief_description: Miss Tai Ai-Lien presents two traditional Chinese folk dances, the Yao ceremonial prelude which is used at marriages and funerals, and a solo dance drama called ‘The Mute and the Cripple’. There is no dialogue or commentary, these presentations of little-known Chinese dances are accompanied by authentic folk music played on flute and drums.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wan-go Wen and Chinese Film Enterprises of America

results.title: Two brothers in Greece
results.brief_description: Looks at two Greek brothers, one who remains in the village of Peloponnesus to continue farming, thus helping his brother financially as he goes to engineering school, while the other runs a tourist boat through the Greek Isles.
